intro: Tribulus taiwanense, commonly known as Taiwan's spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough, hairy texture, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain several seeds. Tribulus taiwanense is often found in rocky or sandy soils, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native habitats.
